content.description: Sit start with a right hand pinch on the arete  and a low left hand undercling. From there, reach a left hand sidepull-sloper, bump it further to a sidepull edge on the opposing arete, bump the right hand up to a great pocket, reach the lip, and top it out using the many features for an easy mantel.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The landing has a rock in the middle of it.
content.location: It climbs the northwest arete of Battle Tax.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the jug-sloper. From there, pull through a pair of edges to reach the three mono-pockets above, then the lip, and an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad will work. There is a rock in the landing that makes it slightly uneven, but it pads well.
content.location: It climbs the center of Battle Tax's north face.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the sloper-jug. From there, bump up to the great sidepull, then use the edges and bumps to traverse right to the boulder's apex, and pull on top using the many features.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The landing has a rock square in the middle of it.
content.location: It climbs the north face overhang of Battle Tax.

content.description: Sit start with a pair of edges. From there, pull up to a pair of edges, reach the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pad will work. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the center of Battle Tax's south face.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand two-finger sidepull and a right hand edge-pinch. From there, stand up tall to a right hand bump, follow to a left hand edge, then match on big sidepull, reach a pair of circular edges, then the lip, and mantel on top the boulder.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is good, but there is a rock just left of where the problem climbs.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Battle Tax.
